blogData.title: Samples From A Voice Over Robot: French, German and Dutch
blogData.description:
In this post we look at what the ai dubbing application sounds like in
  French, German and Dutch. We use the quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog as the
  seed and use an AI as the voice over robot.
blogData.keywords: ai transcription, ai translation, ai translator, ai localization, Transcribe Audio, Video Text To Speech, Audio Text To Speech, Dubbing, Internationalization, Localization, Internationalisation, Localisation, AI Voice Over, AI Voice Overlay, AI Speech Overlay, Dubbing App, Dubbing Audio Over Video, Dubbing French, Dubbing German, Dubbing Dutch, Text To Speech AI, Voice Over Robot, youtube subtitles, video caption, youtube captions
blogData.coverAlt: Samples From A Voice Over Robot: French, German and Dutch

data.richContent:
Following on from last week’s blog post, where we looked at different English dialects, we are going to do much the same today in Dutch, French and German.

Do you like the below examples? Let us know - we are super keen to hear what you think?

To try other languages (for FREE!) sign up to the free trial and give it a go!

Steps

  1. First, as per our usual create a new item using the English language template. We called our new item simpleA and it looks like below. All the action is going to happen in our Audio component shown below.
  2. Use the audio component to add our seed, The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog as shown below.
  3. In the English dialect example, we transcribed directly. We do something different here, we translate first, and then use the AI dubbing.
  4. Use the Action -> Translate to translate to Dutch, French and German. French is shown the process is the same for each of the languages.
  5. On completing this, your screen should look something like below.
  6. Each item will have the same content, except in the correct language.
  7. Now use the the Action -> Transcribe: Text-To-Speech to create the synthetic dubbing's for all the items. The German and Dutch transcription menu’s are shown below. In the samples today, we used female voices.

  8. The below is the image for the French transcription menu. Be careful! There are two dialects here, French (Canada) and French (France). In the below, we have chosen Canadian French. Note: Because the seed is tiny, the French dialects sound pretty similar.
  9. Woohoo - all done. Do you want to hear what all the other AI voices sound like? Give our application a free trial today!

Samples

Dutch Female 1

French Female 1 (Canadian)

French Female 1 (France)

German Female 1

Conclusion

In this visual guide, we used our video translator to translate and then dub a sample text fragment.

Would you like to try this functionality? Send us some feedback if you do.

Please connect with us on LinkedIn, YouTube or Facebook for any comments, questions, or just to keep up to date with the work we do!

We are very grateful for your support!

If you are interested in trying out our technology, please try our platform or drop us an email at hello@videotranslator.ai.

nodes.title: Flag Monkey Goes Swedish!
nodes.description: A good friend of ours, Flag Monkey, decided to try out our service! Specifically he was looking at Swedish.
